activities:
CPP collects, receives and processes Customer Personal Information and Business Personal Information about residents of EU or EEA member states and Switzerland in the course of its activities as follows:

“Customer Personal Information” means personal information of individuals who are customers or former customers, clients or former clients of CPP or CPP’s distributors, such as name, email address, telephone number, billing information, shipping information, payment information, account information, ID number, responses to assessments, scoring of responses, analysis of scoring and responses, payment information, session data, and similar information.  

“Business Personal Information” means personal information of business contacts, such as name and business title, business address, business telephone number, business e-mail address and similar information.

CPP collects, receives and processes Customer Personal Information and Business Personal Information in connection with the promotion, sale and provision of its products and services, such as administering assessments and developing and communicating reports on these assessments; shipping books; conducting surveys; ensuring information security; managing business contact and experience directory; managing company computing resource; managing company sales, reporting, and communications with distributor network; ensuring authentication and personalization, and managing its websites, as more specifically described in CPP’s current Privacy Policy.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Client, customer and research data online and offline
